result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles O. Presley IV

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM  Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Charles O. Presley IV in court.  Attorney Philip Edward Marry in court for Charles O. Presley IV. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: The State requests to speak with Attorney Marry off the record in the conference room; Court takes a brief break. Back on the record at 1:35 PM. Same appearances. Victim rights compliance. Two family members of the victim appear in court. Attorney Marry is requesting an adjournment as he needs additional time to hire a private investigator and complete his investigation. The State does not object to that request. ADA Tombasco advises the Court that he spoke with the victims of the record and they are requesting 2 additional no contacts. Discussion held on the record. Court modifies bond conditions to include no contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: R.H. (6/21/16) or B.H. (9/4/14). Court waives the DE's signature on the amended bond. DE acknowledges on the record that he is aware of these new conditions and remaining conditions of bond.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:10 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Charles O. Presley, appeared with Attorney Philip Edward Marry.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Marry is requesting an adjournment so he can complete some follow up investigator and then he will know if the is resolved or if it will need to be scheduled for trial. The State does not object. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Adjustment Number: 22A 354532,
Payable Number: 344034,
Receipt Number: 22R 017509,
Amount: $20.00
Holding bond money hook up to case - Issuing agency on case and bond do not match - need clarification from DA  8/12/22

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued posted bond applied.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Ronald H, Breanna H, Heather H.

01:27 PM    Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Case was assigned to Br. 1.  A new tab has been pulled and the case is now assigned to Br. 3 pursuant to court rule.  Plea of Not Guilty entered. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am. DE is on PO Hold. $150  Cash bond posted and continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
and witness list filed by the State
